description:
Every year, we welcome thousands of university students from every corner of the world to join Microsoft. You bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.

At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passions and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology. The internship is designed not only for you to do great work with the opportunity to learn and grow, but to experience our culture full of diverse community connection, executive engagement, and memorable events.

We’re a company of learn-it-alls rather than know-it-alls and our culture is centered around embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Does this sound like you? Learn more about our cultural attributes.

Are you ready to join us and create the future? Come as you are, do what you love—start your journey with us today!

Responsibilities

Explore Microsoft is a 12-week summer internship program specifically designed for students in their first or second year of a bachelor’s degree program who would like to learn more about careers in software development through a learning program. Throughout the internship you will:

  • Gain hands-on experience with various tools and programming languages in the field of software development.
  • Work closely with your Manager and Mentors to evaluate requirements, estimate costs, create and implement features and services.
  • Experience both core tech disciplines (Program Manager and Software Engineer) during the 12-week internship.

Qualifications

  • Must be freshman (class of 2025) or sophomore (class of 2024) student, currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program within the United States, Canada or Mexico.
  • Demonstrated interest in majoring in computer science, computer engineering, software engineering or related technical major.
  • Completed an Introduction to Computer Science course (or equivalent class) as well as one semester of calculus (or equivalent) by the start of the program.
Visit our Explore Microsoft Page to learn more about the interview process and answers to commonly asked questions

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Minimum Clearance Required to Start:

Not Applicable/None

Job Description:

Ready to advance your education and have the opportunity to work on large scale engineering projects? Parsons is now accepting applications for an Engineering Co-op Student who have a great attention to detail and ready join a rapidly growing team, enhancing the fabric of our community.

Parsons extensive experience in this field, combined with your willingness to work hard will propel your career and opportunities forward. We need our interns to be versatile, enthusiastic to work in highly flexible, team-oriented environments that have exceptional communication, analytical and organizational skills

In this role, under direction of engineers at the Army Research Laboratory in Adelphi, MD, you will perform a variety of basic to moderately-difficult engineering support assignments requiring a fundamental knowledge of computer science, machine learning and deep learning/neural networks. The intern student at this level will support research, basic engineering and software design and analysis, and data collation to support research projects.

Responsibilities:
Review and analysis of existing code

Literature reviews and surveys for relevant research and development

Data collection/data compilation

Support algorithm development

Basic software development

Scene classification

Qualifications:
Must be enrolled in a computer science curriculum at an accredited college or university and have completed at least one year of study
Relevant course work required
Familiarity and/or experience with machine learning/deep learning algorithms and applications and computer vision

DreamWorks Animation seeks a Feature FX Intern for our virtual Internship Program! This Intern will be assigned to a feature film and gain insight into production responsibilities, workflows, and processes.

Day in the Life:
The Feature FX intern will be responsible for various activities under the direction of the FX Team and will have the opportunity to attend and contribute to FX team meetings. Ideal candidates will be willing to take on new challenges to gain more detailed knowledge of the animation industry, feature animation pipeline, and workflows.

Candidates should understand the basics of designing and creating images, elements, and effects (such as fire, smoke, water, destruction, magic, etc.) for CG. Additionally, candidates should be comfortable multitasking, working independently on assignments, discern priorities, and hit deadlines. Strong communication skills, the ability to interact professionally with others, and being respectful and punctual in meetings are necessary for a successful candidate.

Submission Requirements:
  • Upload Resume and Cover Letter
  • Include Link to Demo Reel/Breakdown on your resume (include password if protected)

Qualifications/Requirements

  • Enrolled in an Undergraduate or Graduate program at a College/University (or equivalent), or be a recent graduate (within six months of graduation date).
  • Must be 18 years of age or older.
  • Must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship.
  • Ability to commit ten weeks part-time (16-24 hours/week) and work remotely from September 2021 - December 2021
  • Must be able to provide equipment (PC, webcam, headphones, etc.) and have a stable internet connection in order to remotely connect to DreamWorks workstations via remote software.
  • Working knowledge of animation principles.
  • Understanding of software like Houdini, Nuke, or similar 3D packages for use in particle systems, fluid simulation, rigid bodies, procedural geometry, and compositing.
  • Ability to self-critique creative work, address notes, and expand upon the art direction given.
  • Candidates should be well-organized, highly self-motivated individuals who function well in fast-paced production environments.

Desired Characteristics

  • Education in animation/graphics/computer science/VFX (or equivalent) program; traditional artistic training a plus.
  • Adobe Animate or Toon Boom knowledge is a plus.
  • Working knowledge of Shotgrid is a plus.
  • Experience in scripting and or programming is a plus.

About Us

From the award-winning storytellers, artist and innovators at DreamWorks Animation and DreamWorks Animation Television come the beloved characters and stories that come alive on the big and small screens. From films like Shrek, How to Train Your Dragon and Trolls to original TV series including Trollhunters, Voltron and Home: Adventures with Tip & Oh, DreamWorks Animation continues to bring home the laughter, fun and courage to dream.

Visit www.dreamworksanimation.com to see our latest animated film and television productions.

DreamWorks is a division of NBCUniversal. At NBCUniversal, we believe in the talent of our people. It’s our passion and commitment to excellence that drives NBCU’s vast portfolio of brands to succeed. From broadcast and cable networks, news and sports platforms, to film, world-renowned theme parks and a diverse suite of digital properties, we take pride in all that we do and all that we represent. It’s what makes us uniquely NBCU. Here you can create the extraordinary. Join us.

NBCUniversal owns and operates over 20 different businesses across 30 countries including a valuable portfolio of news and entertainment television networks, a premier motion picture company, significant television production operations, a leading television stations group, world-renowned theme parks and a premium ad-supported streaming service.

Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. We strive to foster a diverse and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. We believe that our workforce should represent the communities we live in, so that together, we can continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world. Click here to learn more about Comcast NBCUniversal’s commitment and how we are making an impact.

Notices

NBCUniversal’s policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, where applicable.

NVIDIA is using the power of GPU computing and AI to revolutionize healthcare by transforming data analysis in domains such as DNA sequencing. We are seeking passionate and hardworking individuals to help us realize our mission of bringing personalized medicine to mainstream healthcare.

As an HPC Engineer Intern, you will join a fast-paced development team focused on bioinformatics algorithm development and collaborations with industry and academic partners. This position provides the opportunity to define, implement, productize, and deliver high-performance computing software for a wide range of bioinformatics applications used worldwide. If you are interested in taking on the greatest healthcare computational challenges for your internship, this would be a perfect opportunity!

What you will be doing:

  • Study and develop cutting-edge techniques in bioinformatics, graph algorithms, machine learning, and perform in-depth analysis and optimization to ensure the best possible performance on current- and next-generation GPU architectures.

  • Work directly with key customers to understand the current and future problems they are solving and provide the best HPC solutions.

  • Collaborate closely with hardware engineering, CUDA engineering, and AI research groups to apply the latest technology to enable novel genomic analysis at scale.

What we need to see:

  • You are pursuing your MS degree or PhD in Computer Science, or a similar technical field of study.

  • Strong knowledge of C/C++, software design, and programming techniques.

  • Experience with the design and implementation of complex algorithms and data structures.

  • Parallel programming experience using multi-threading or MPI.

  • Understanding of computer system architecture and operating systems.

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Knowledge and understanding of parallel programming, thread programming, concurrency control, and scalability.

  • Experience with CUDA programming and NVIDIA GPUs.

  • Background with DL and Machine Learning algorithms.

  • Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills to effectively guide and influence within a dynamic, technical environment.

NVIDIA offers highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us to provide capabilities to the life sciences industry which could not be imagined even a few years ago. If you're creative and love building the next generation of technologies that will be used throughout the world and have a real passion for technology, we want to hear from you.

The Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act requires that NVIDIA provide the compensation range and benefits offered for this position if performed in Colorado. The base hourly range for this position in Colorado is $31.80 - 43.73 USD.

NVIDIA also offers a comprehensive benefits package. We provide health care coverage, dental and vision, 401(K), including company matching and after tax contributions, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company paid holidays, paid sick leave, vacation leave, professional time off, life and disability protection. Employees in eligible sales and positions may also be eligible for commission.

Base pay is based on market location and may vary based on factors including experience, skills, education, and other job-related reasons.

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Are you ready to learn and grow your career in IT? If so, Capital Metro has an internship opportunity for you.

This position will perform professional support work in the Information Technology Department and will work with the Help Desk team in configuring, deploying and retiring desktops/laptops.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
  • Customer Service
  • Delivers, tags, and assists in the configuration of end-user PC desktop hardware, software and peripheral equipment.
  • Executes PC retirement process for End-of-Life computer equipment
  • Organizes PC Stock room
  • Identifies, diagnoses and resolves Level I problems for users of personal computer software and hardware, agency network, the internet and new computer technology in a call center environment and communicates solutions to end users
  • Support Capital Metro’s safety culture by following safety and security policies, considering safety in every action and reporting safety and security concerns.
  • Perform other duties as required and/or assigned.
WHAT YOU BRING
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Must be currently enrolled in a degree program at a college or university
  • Enrollment in an information technology degree program is preferred.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Windows architecture, of customer service and working team concepts.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
  • Desktop operating systems, various software applications and basic hardware for the PC; principles and theories of network systems and management; Internet technologies and products.
  • Good oral and written communication skills and ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
  • Ability to coordinate several diverse job requirements and projects.
  • Ability to lift and carry 70 lbs. with assistance
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU
  • Work with a diverse, collaborative and energetic workforce whose focus is to bring innovation into the industry and how we serve our customers and team members.
  • When not working remotely, utilize our free and reduced fare transit service to get to the office and then plan to hit the gym (for free) and work with our onsite trainers, before heading back home.
  • …and much more!
WHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW
Capital Metro is deeply committed to building a workplace where inclusion is not only valued but prioritized. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating a welcoming and diverse environment. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, pregnancy, age, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws. Capital Metro makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and organization needs at the time.

PAY RANGE - 11.00 - 18.00 - HOURLY

JOB SUMMARY:

ZIVARO is currently seeking a qualified IT intern for our Solutions & Engineering Services team. This is a paid opportunity available in the Denver or Remotely. Interested candidates should have a firm career path in Engineering, Information Systems, or Business, with solid academic training in one or more of the respective disciplines, and with excellent multi-tasking and communication skills. The summer internship program at ZIVARO may include a comprehensive curriculum consisting of a Cloud project, customer-facing interactions, ISO compliance, Opportunity management, and invoicing, Splunk development, tech stats, and a reverse internship with the leaders of the business unit.


POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Having an interest in technology and all the processes that interact with tech projects.
  • Ability to work with multiple groups of people in order to achieve a unified result.
  • Interest and excitement in technology, project management, application development, and customer service.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to prioritize based on opportunities and effectively multitask
  • Willingness to share ideas and improve processes.
  • Strong desire to create, implement and produce a result within the tech landscape.
  • Understanding of IT systems is desirable.
  • Currently enrolled or recently graduated in any of the following majors: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, IT, Information Systems, Engineering, Business, Data Science

Physical Requirements:

  • Able to frequently lift up to 35 pounds
  • Frequently sit for long periods at desk using computer


QUALIFICATIONS:

ZIVARO is looking for a person who is currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program or a recent graduate. Ideally, this person is organized, has a strong work ethic, is technologically minded. This person must have the ability to work as a member of the team, strong communication with internal and external stakeholders and have a proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment. In addition, this person would have exceptional presentation skills, a positive attitude, excellent verbal and written communication skills, and technical curiosity. If you are willing to exceed expectations and have a good attitude- this role may be for you!


U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions at Zivaro, due to security clearance and government/federal contracts held by Zivaro.

EEO STATEMENT

ZIVARO fully subscribes to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity. It is our policy to provide employment, compensation and other benefits related to employment based on qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. In accordance with requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act, it is our policy to provide reasonable accommodation upon request during the application process to eligible applicants in order that they may be given a full and fair opportunity to be considered for employment. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we intend to comply fully with applicable federal and state employment laws and the information requested on this application will only be used for purposes consistent with those laws.

The User Research Internship is a part-time, 6 month program that supports the academic growth of students enrolled in a college/university with an interest in the User Experience field, with the potential for full-time hire after graduation. Interns will gain practical, hands-on experience in various research methodologies, with a focus on survey creation, interviewing, usability testing, and screening/recruiting participants. Interns will work remotely for 20-25 hours per week on a set (but flexible) schedule.

Job Responsibilities

I. Prepare, Conduct, Analyze Research

  • Create surveys using Alchemer

  • Run usability tests and interview clients on the zoom/in person

  • Analyze quantitative and qualitative research

  • Prepare research readouts/decks that effectively communicate research findings to stakeholders

II. Recruit Research Participants

  • Work with User Researchers to determine target-user traits/criteria

  • Create screeners to ensure participants meet the criteria

  • Pull lists of clients who qualify for research

  • Use Ethn.io tool to schedule the research meetings, most of which happen via Zoom

  • Schedule and invite team members to research sessions using Outlook

  • Compensate clients who have participated in a research study via our gift card platform

III. Support the User Research Team

  • Take detailed notes during research sessions and brainstorm meetings

  • Contact clients via email and phone to book research sessions in person or remotely

  • Support the workload of User Researchers & Recruiters as needed

Desired Research Experience

  • Experience conducting research in the social sciences or humanities

  • Experience analyzing/coding qualitative and/or quantitative data

  • Experience interviewing research participants

  • Experience building rapport with research participants

We’re looking for you to…

  • Be excited about User Experience Research and a drive to learn about the broader UX field

  • Be outgoing and very comfortable talking to clients on the phone/interviewing them

  • Be incredibly organized and capable of juggling multiple projects at the same time

  • Be self-driven, finding innovative ways to help the team when there is lull in your task load

  • Fully own research projects from start to finish, while keeping manager up-to-date on their status

  • Be proficient in Google Docs and Spreadsheets


Education

Be currently enrolled in a college/university, preferably in a UX or Research-related program (Psychology, Anthropology, Sociology, Computer Science, Graphic Design, Industrial Design)

Company Overview

Native is a platform using A.I. to understand consumer preferences and helping Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) companies create products that people love. It is the only platform in the market that uses end-to-end data and artificial intelligence to optimize CPG products and supply chains. Our platform consists of three natively unified applications that accelerate R&D at all levels.

Native was founded in 2018 in New York City with additional offices in St. Louis, Cincinnati and Miami.

*
Role Overview
*
*

  • Work alongside Native’s CTO, product, engineering & data science teams in a fast-paced environment to create an innovative software product
  • Attend sprint planning and demo calls with engineering and product teams to ensure UX/UI is considered in all aspects of our product roadmapping and feature enhancements
  • Evaluate the UX/UI of industry competitor platforms
  • Monitor product feedback & analytics from customers to determine which modules & features are most successful and identify those that need most improvement
  • Generate mock-ups & wireframes for new Native software products
  • Using Native’s branding kit to design company materials including: investment decks, sales decks, case studies etc.

*
*
Preferred Requirements
*
*

  • Pursuing college degree in one of the following focus area: Business, Computer Science, Computer-Human Interaction and/or working towards UX/UI certifications
  • Available 15-20 hours per week
  • Prior UX/UI internship experience

*

Job Types: Part-time, Contract, Internship

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

  • UI: 1 year (Required)
  • UX: 1 year (Required)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

Overview:
Shure offers a challenging and rewarding internship program. This internship opportunity is offered to undergraduate students that have completed at least 2 years of college, as well as graduate students. Each intern will receive a competitive salary and students who reside out of Illinois will receive a housing stipend to cover living expenses. Applications will be collected, reviewed and selected candidates will be contacted in late fall/early winter.

As a Data Science Intern, you will work with a team of engineers who research, prototype, implement and demonstrate use cases in machine learning and artificial intelligence that make Shure products smarter, more performant, and more insightful. You will identify and capture datasets that you will use to train and assess predictive models that derive insights from structured and/or unstructured data.
Qualifications:
  • Minimum two years of coursework in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related field with coursework in data science
  • Masters level candidates a plus
  • Experience with big data technologies and cloud-based services for data storage and processing
  • Knowledge of machine learning and deep learning models and frameworks
  • Knowledge of full stack development with languages such as Python, Java, JavaScript, and C++
  • Experience with embedded development is desired
  • Creativity and curiosity for future technologies and a passion for realizing new capabilities

Media Island is a Digital Marketing agency specializing in the international tourism industry, specifically with Central American tourism agencies. We work on campaigns highly targeted to Miami, FL, and surrounding areas to increase our clients' branding and to improve their client acquisition processes.

We are currently recruiting an intern for a Website Design Internship position with strong experience in web design skills. All student candidates must be currently enrolled in a college, university, or technical school. for the fall 2021 semester. This will be an unpaid internship for college credit.

Candidates should display strong written and verbal communication skills, as well as an eagerness to learn. Bi-lingual in Spanish and English preferred, but not required. You must know how to code, design, and know API integration.

Students will be asked to intern at least twenty-four hours a week but we will do our best to work with your schedule.

Job Description: The Website Design intern will assist in creating the look, layout, and features of our client's websites. The position involves understanding both graphic design and computer programming. The designer helps with maintenance and additions to the website. They work with development teams and managers for keeping the site up-to-date and prioritizing needs, among other tasks.

Prior Experience with the following software is preferred:

· HTML5

· InVision

· Adobe Creative Suite

· WordPress

· JavaScript

· Click Funnels

Skills & Key Qualifications:

  • Cut down our offer creation-to-launch time
  • Data-driven & decisive decision-making skills
  • Ambitious and highly motivated to perform at the highest level
  • Quickly gain a deep understanding of our brand, programs, and clients
  • Prioritizes actions & tests based on the easiest levers to pull with the biggest results
  • Able to quickly generate a responsive & full-stack funnel, with ideal/correct UX & UI
  • In-depth knowledge of Clickfunnels and “Funnel Hacking”
  • Strong understanding of all areas of digital marketing- SEO, Ads placement, email marketing, automation sequences, etc.
  • Create an A/B Testing SOP to test 1 variable per week (minimum) per offer/funnel with reliable tracking metrics (UTMs)
  • Monitors funnel changes, duplications, and tests so that they remain stable throughout the new offer launches and updates to existing funnel flows
  • Able to troubleshoot, identify, and fix any Clickfunnel issues

Requirements

  • Willing to try, not afraid to fail: You need a willingness to learn and master unfamiliar skills. We operate in a unique, non-traditional way and require you to adapt to our operations. We are after learning and embrace that failure is a part of that process.
  • Seeking constant self-improvement: We strive to be an organization where the best ideas succeed. We communicate and operate transparently. We strive for continuous evolution and do not shy from giving honest feedback for the greater good of the organization. You must be open to receiving and giving feedback for the greater good of the company.
  • Work hard, play hard mentality: Our primary responsibility is taking care of our clients. You must be willing to get the job done.
  • Ability to work 24+ hours/week: This will be a remote position.

Qualifications

  • Bachelors degree preferred in Computer Science, Web Design or related fields.
  • 2+ years of prior experience in website design and managing websites.
  • Prior experience at a digital marketing agency.
  • Strong knowledge of social media trends and the competitive landscape of digital marketing.
  • Conversational and written fluency in Spanish is strongly preferred.
  • Excellent time-management, organization, and communication skills.
  • Ability to work effectively under pressure and balance priorities.
  • Strong analytic skills.
  • Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.

The fall 2021 Website Design internship at Media Island is an incredible way to get experience working within a digital marketing agency. All applicants must be available to start as soon as possible.

Job Description

As an ALSAC intern, you will learn from experts who have helped us become one of America’s top healthcare charities while supporting the life-saving mission of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital.

Our fall program offers a 10 week fully immersed experience. You will be assigned a day to day manager in your industry and our program manager will lead you with networking and professional development events.

  • Start Date: August 30, 2021

  • End Date: November 5, 2021

  • Hours: 20 hours a week (Monday-Friday)

  • Pay Rate: All ALSAC interns are paid. Pay rate is based on work location.

  • Work Location: Headquarters Office in Memphis, TN

Requirements:

  • A passion for our mission!

  • Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university and in good standing.

  • Must be comfortable with Zoom and Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, and Power Point.

  • Ability to work in a team environment but also work strong independently.

  • Ability to be organized and detailed to balance several projects simultaneously.

  • Must be able to maintain confidentiality.

  • Must be 18 years of age or older.

Specific Internship Description and Preferred Skills:

The ALSAC Information Security Team is looking for an intern that will become an integral part of our diverse team. At ALSAC, the intern will be able to help protect our assets while working on innovative projects.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Assignments may include responsibilities in one or more of the following areas:

  • Security event analysis, triage, containment, remediation, and reporting

  • Information Security Awareness for Developers

  • Network Security –vulnerability assessments, and computer forensics

  • Malware Analysis – disassemble and debug malicious software, dynamic analysis via virtual machine technology, programming with C/C++/Java/C#/Go/Python

  • Web Application security Testing (owasp top 10, etc.)

Required qualifications to be successful in this role:

  • Knowledge and understanding of common information and cyber security technologies (e.g. NIDS/HIDS, Web Proxies, Vulnerability Scanners)

  • Understanding of common ports and protocols

  • Familiarity with network packet capture tools

  • Academic background in information security, computer science, computer engineering or a similar major with extensive computer-based or technical content

  • A great attitude and hunger for learning

  • Excellent analytical, written and oral communication skills

  • Ability to work within a team environment

  • 3.0 GPA or greater (strongly preferred)

Majors preferred: Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or Information Technology or related field of study.

Skills preferred: Excel, Nmap, Linux/Unbutu, Python

Application & Interview Process:

After you submit your application and if you meet requirements, you will be sent an email to complete a virtual video interview from HireVue. Your submission will be reviewed and if you are selected to move forward, you will be contacted for a Zoom interview with the hiring manger. Final candidates will be selected by August 20, 2021.

For more information, visit stjude.org/alsacintern

ALSAC is an equal employment opportunity employer.

ALSAC does not discriminate against any individual with regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, disability, veteran status, genetic information or other protected status.

position: R&D FX Engineering Intern (Virtual), DreamWorks, Fall 2021
description:
62033BR
Internships
Filmed Entertainment Group

Responsibilities

DreamWorks is excited to announce that we are currently accepting resumes for our Fall 2021 Software Engineering Internship for FX/CFX within our Research & Development and Creative Technologies teams. The engineering teams at DreamWorks develop state-of-the-art techniques, algorithms, and tools that are core to the production of our CG animated films.

During the course of a 10-week internship, interns will design, implement, and support aspects of the company’s proprietary software tools. They will work closely with our world-class artists and top engineers in this field. Some of our engineers started themselves as interns here at Dreamworks and are now leading efforts that are recognized industry-wide.

Interns will learn to:
  • Create unique software solutions that unleash the highly ambitious and creative visions of our artists
  • Innovate to provide our world-class artists with the best tools and deliver a competitive advantage to the studio
  • Work hand-in-hand with the most talented artists anywhere and have an immediate, positive impact on their work
  • Work in a collaborative environment
  • Develop problem-solving skills

Qualifications/Requirements

What We Are Looking For:
  • Current student/recent grad majoring in Computer Science, Computer Graphics, Physics, and Mathematics or related field(s)
  • Strong interest in animation; passion for how technology and art work together
  • Dedicated, resourceful, an excellent communicator, possesses critical thinking skills, and is a team player.
  • Ability to commit ten weeks part-time (16-24 hours/week) and work remotely from September 2021 - December 2021
  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • Must have strong grades and excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Must have own equipment (computer, webcam, headphones, etc.) and stable Internet connection
  • Must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship

Desired Characteristics

  • Your resume and cover letter
  • A link to any websites (Github, Stack Overflow, etc) or blog indicating technical skills such as math and programming.
  • Relevant coursework listed at the top of your resume is helpful as well.

position: Engineering Intern- Factory Data, Data Science (Fall 2021)
description:
at Rivian Automotive
United States, California, Palo Alto

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois.

Disclaimer:

Factory Data is the central team within Manufacturing Engineering that delivers advanced analytics, strategic inference, and online algorithms critical to Rivian’s mission. To enable that work we build and use Rivian’s Factory Data Cloud - the cohesive platform that enables the tight data and model integrations our factories need to enable Rivian to scale with unprecedented quality, speed, and operational performance. Our customers are Manufacturing Engineering and a broad cross-section of Rivian’s organizations including Production, Quality, Product Design, Reliability, and of course ourselves.

Internship Term: Fall 2021
Rivian internships are experiences optimized for student candidates. To be eligible, you must be an undergraduate or graduate student in an accredited program during the internship term. If you are not pursuing a degree, please see our full time positions at Rivian.com/careers

Note that if your university has specific requirements for internship programs, it is your responsibility to fulfill those requirements.

Role Responsibilities:

    • Deliver data and analytics products that will be core to how Rivian operates, monitors, and debugs issues in our factories.

    • Develop “analytics as code” in the form of sophisticated data apps (built primarily with R + shiny).

    • Work with stakeholders to do ad-hoc exploratory data analysis on high-priority/high-visibility issues.

    • Partner with Manufacturing Engineers to develop data integrations enabling visibility into manufacturing production, equipment, processes, and product tests.

    • Create and maintain data transformations that provide clean/structured data for our reporting and decision automation pipelines.

    • Define code based KPIs from our clean reporting data with appropriate domain awareness.

    • Evangelize data products, information, and tools to cross-functional groups.

    • Design experiments to accelerate production learning and improvements.

    • Work to mature our modern data environment (Stitch, dbt, and Snowflake on AWS) and develop tools and packages to accelerate our work.

Qualifications:

  • 1+ previous internship experiences, in final year of undergraduate or graduate studies for a Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or

  • Proficiency with SQL - knowledge of tidy data structures for analytics/reporting is a bonus

  • proficiency with R or Python and willingness to become comfortable with both to support a multilingual team

  • Experience building interactive data applications (e.g. R Shiny, Plotly Dash, Python Streamlit) preferred

  • Experience using version controlled workflows preferred

  • Exceptional verbal, written, and visual communication skills in a cross-functional environment

  • Exceptional skills developing written and visual data narratives

Equal Opportunity

position: Electronic Trading Associate - Expert Summer Intern Programme - 2022
description:
The team that powers electronic trading

The Statistical Modeling and Development team as part of Barclays’ Front Office trading, creates eTrading (agency and internal algorithms) models, machine learning models, undertakes other data science and software development projects. The team partners with Sales & Trading, Technology, Risk and other control functions to deliver industry-leading algorithms for automated pricing, risk management and execution across all asset classes. Join us as an intern and discover where technical discipline and business intersect.

What to expect

As an Electronic Trading intern, you’ll take your first steps in the extremely challenging and fascinating world of algorithmic trading & data science. Working with a broad spectrum of colleagues, you’ll learn how data science fits into our business. What’s more, you’ll help our team to turn mathematical and algorithmic ideas into trading reality.

Our program runs in two streams – Research and Engineering. This allows us to align you with problems tailored to your skill sets and interests. In the Research stream, you will spend time modeling research, prototyping your theory and testing how it can function in various scenarios. The Engineering stream will allow you to code and learn how theory is converted into practice. Your pieces of code could even be delivered into a production style environment.


In this intensely computing-based role, you could get involved in:

  • learning to use statistical models and algorithmic coding in practice
  • test practical machine learning techniques
  • researching and implementing new models
  • expanding our computational platform by helping solve complex software development problems.

How you’ll develop

Throughout the summer, our support will help you deliver your best work. In our team-driven environment, you’ll find that mentoring happens naturally and friendships are easy to form. Mentors will guide your progress, and networking and social events will provide a fully rounded experience.

As part of your summer experience, you’ll receive performance feedback. By the time the summer’s over, you’ll walk away with a solid understanding of eTrading business, our culture and your potential place within it. We invite top-performing, eligible summer associates to join us full-time after graduation.


To be considered for this program, you must:

  • be working towards a PhD or Master’s in a technical discipline such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, physics, quantitative finance, operations research or similar
  • be on track to complete your degree between December 2022 – June 2023.

Who thrives here:

  • people with strong logical thinking, problem solving, mathematical aptitude
  • people with exceptional computational thinking and strong programming skills in JAVA/C++, R, Python or similar programming languages
  • communication skills and a teamwork mentality are key in this role.

Ready to apply?

Please submit an application to Barclays’ online system. Then, submit your resume and cover letter through your school’s career management application system if required. Please note that you can apply to only one Barclays’ internship program globally.


About Barclays

Barclays is a British universal bank. We are diversified by business, by different types of customers and clients, and by geography. Our businesses include consumer banking and payments operations around the world, as well as a top-tier, full service, global corporate and investment bank, all of which are supported by our service company which provides technology, operations and functional services across the firm.


We are an equal opportunity employer and we are opposed to discrimination on any grounds.


Dynamic working gives everyone at Barclays the opportunity to integrate professional and personal lives, if you have a need for flexibility then please discuss this with the hiring manager.


Our Purpose and Values

We deploy finance responsibly to support people and businesses, acting with empathy and integrity, championing innovation and sustainability for the common good and the long term.


Our values underpin everything we do: Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and Stewardship.


Respect

We harness the power of diversity and inclusion in our business, trust those we work with, and value everyone's contribution.


For further information about Barclays, please visit our website home.barclays


To learn more about careers at Barclays, visit search.jobs.barclays

position: Machine Learning / AI - Engineering & Research Internship (ICML 2021)
description:
Summary

Posted: Jul 12, 2021
Role Number:200229866
Apple is seeking highly qualified people for the position of AI/ML Engineer and AI/ML Research Intern. The team pursues research & development in the areas of machine learning (ML) with particular focus on deep learning (DL), computer vision (CV), Natural Language Processing (NLP), optimization, and reinforcement learning (RL). As a member of the team, you will work on some of the most ambitious technical problems, develop new ML solutions that will impact future Apple products, and collaborate with the best product teams to integrate your ideas into products. In addition, you will engage with the academic community by publishing your innovative research, and speaking at conferences and events.
Key Qualifications
  • In-depth expertise in deep learning (DL) and statistical machine learning (ML)
  • Expertise in one or more of CV, NLP, optimization, RL, time series, generative models, signals, pattern recognition fields, and/or computer graphics fields
  • Strong publication record demonstrating innovative research
  • Good presentation skills
  • Passionate about building extraordinary products
  • Excellent programming skills in Java, Python, C/C++, CUDA or other GPGPU is a plus
  • Knowledge of common ML frameworks
  • Expected to perform well in a fast-paced environment, to execute on the tasks assigned, to meet the production deadlines and, at the same time, to explore independently new innovative ideas that can improve and transform the product experience of Apple customers
  • Be able to deliver ML technologies aligned with the core values of Apple, ensuring the highest standards of quality, scientific rigor, innovation, and respect for user privacy
  • Creative, collaborative, & product focused
Description
You will research and develop innovative ML strategies for challenging problems that will affect future Apple products. You will collaborate with broader teams across Apple to transfer AI/ML solutions. You will have opportunities to provide technical mentorship and guidance and prepare technical reports for publication and conference talks. You are self-motivated, excellent problem solver, a go-getter. You are quick to build relationships and work well with change and ambiguity. You have strong programming skills with tried experience crafting, prototyping, and delivering advanced algorithmic solutions.
Education & Experience
PhD, Masters, or Bachelors degree in Machine Learning, Human Computer Interaction, Natural Language Processing, Robotics, Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics or related areas.

Anduril is a defense technology company, bringing Silicon Valley talent and funding to the defense sector. Our technology helps our customers solve their toughest challenges by enabling them to make better, more informed decisions in life-and-death situations. We’ve assembled a diverse team of experts in artificial intelligence, computer vision, sensor fusion, optics, and data analysis that are creating software and hardware solutions to radically evolve the capabilities of the United States and our allies. If you are passionate about solving problems that have real impact, come join Anduril and build the future of defense.
As a Software Engineer Intern, you will be working alongside a team of engineers with a diverse set of backgrounds and skills. Anduril has a collaborative culture with plenty of opportunities for ownership. As a member of the team, your decisions today will have a large impact on the company now and into the future, as well as our customers. We believe that simple systems are easier to understand, maintain, and scale. You will be making trade-offs as you work to ensure that our systems are prepared to scale - so being able to effectively communicate these trade-offs with your teammates is a must.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

    • Engineers are responsible for the full product lifecycle, including design, implementation, deployment, and maintenance.
    • Collaborate with cross-functional internal hardware & software teams to incorporate their innovations and vice versa.
    • Take feedback to iterate on and improve Anduril’s software systems.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

    • Prior engineering internship experience, along with current academic pursuits & studies in the areas of: Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics.
    • Approaching Junior year or beyond at the time of the internship.
    • Familiarity with algorithms, data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.
    • Proficiency in a variety of programming languages such as Go, Java, C++, Python, JavaScript, etc.
    • A desire to work on software and applications that have real-world impact.
    • U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

    • Have a bias for action. If you see a problem, you want to solve and fix it.
    • Be naturally curious about the technologies and tools you use.
    • Have a point-of-view, but are still low-ego.
Anduril is an equal-opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you are someone passionate to work on problems that matter, we’d love to hear from you!

description:
Qualifications

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Spanish

Who You'll Work With

You'll join our San Jose office as part of our Client Capabilities Network for the McKinsey Global Institute. You will assist in a variety of projects in support of our data platform.
Colleagues in our global Client Capabilities Networkdeliver distinctive client impact through assets and expertise and are driven by a culture of innovation.
McKinsey & Company established the McKinsey Global Institute in 1990 as its independent, internal economics research arm. Its mission is two-fold: to achieve breakthrough microeconomic understanding of the most important global macroeconomic issues today, and to generate insights that materially impact the decisions of both corporate leaders and policymakers.

What You'll Do

You will split your time between content development and knowledge management activities in several long-term research investments.
In content development, you will support the experts in the development of new tools and/or the maintenance of current proprietary databases, especially through database structuring, working on workflow processes and reporting (dashboards). In knowledge management, you will help with the development of supporting documentation, dashboards and newsletters.
The internship will last up to 12 months.

Townsquare Media is offering an unpaid internship program on our Digital Products team to junior developers. This is an opportunity for you to gain exposure to the many facets of a digital media company, learn from a wide range of coding mentors with decades of experience, gain insight into a dynamic work environment, and expand your professional network as well as the opportunity for full-time employment following completion of the internship.

Who Are We?

Townsquare is a community-focused digital media, digital marketing solutions, and radio company focused outside the top 50 markets in the U.S.

Our assets include Townsquare Interactive , a digital marketing services subscription business providing websites, search engine optimization, social platforms, and online reputation management for small and medium businesses (SMBs); Townsquare IGNITE , a proprietary digital programmatic advertising technology with an in-house demand and data management platform; and Townsquare Media , our portfolio of 322 local terrestrial radio stations in 67 cities with corresponding local news and entertainment websites and apps with a network of national music brands (such as XXL and Taste of Country ).

Program Details

This internship will be with the Digital Products team. We build the digital solutions that power all three businesses mentioned above, but the internship will be focused on Townsquare Interactive and Townsquare Media .

12-week, unpaid part-time micro-internship with potential for full-time employment (total time will depend on the internship start, so intern is done before school starts in September)

Full remote (our team is primarily centered around the NY area, but we have members based around the country)

Structure : This program is structured in two parts:
Part 1 Job Rotation (Weeks 1-8): The intern will rotate through eight different teams.

Part 2: Personal Project (Weeks 9-12). During the last four weeks, the intern will work with one of the eight teams on a project of her choice. See below for additional details on the job rotation.

Weekly time commitment : 9 hours

The intern will work with two Team Leads each week

1:1 mentor time per week: 6 hours (will decrease to 3 hours per week during your personal project)

Flexible schedule, but during the workday.

Homework: 2 hours (this will grow when you focus on your personal project)

Group meeting: 1 hour

Qualifications

Rising senior in Computer Science or recent graduate

Knowledge of basic coding languages, especially PHP and JavaScript. (JavaScript is a higher priority.)

Basic programming experience

Ability to learn new software and technologies quickly

Flexibility

Additional Details

Part 1: Job Rotation: the intern will work with eight different teams. The leader of each of those teams will meet 1:1 with the intern, give her small coding assignments, and provide her with feedback on her work. The leader of each team will also share with the intern his/her personal and professional career pathway and help the intern understand how his/her team fits into the overall Townsquare Media company.

Part 2: Personal Project. The intern should note ideas for potential personal projects. During Weeks 9-12, the intern will work more closely with her chosen team to complete her project. During Week 12, the intern will present her Personal Project to the entire team.

Please apply with:
Resume
Cover letter

One or two coding samples:
This could be a school or personal project, such as HTML/JS/PHP (sent as a ZIP file)

Sent as a ZIP file

position: Software Engineering Intern – Full Stack Development
description:
We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern, Full Stack Development.

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will help Markitors fulfill its mission to connect small businesses with their customers.

In this role you’ll not only work on writing code for the Terkel Applications, but also participate in the brainstorming sessions with the team for choosing the best features to help improve Terkel, our knowledge platform. We are looking for someone who has the intuition to work in a collaborative environment. If you have the above-mentioned qualities with strong technical skills in Full Stack Web Development, please apply for this role.

This position requires an strong technical knowledge, a willingness to follow a well-defined process pioneered by our CEO, passion, energy, entrepreneurial spirit, and a commitment to the success of small businesses.

What’s a day-to-day look like? Here it is.

  • Create REST API endpoints for integration between client and back-end services.
  • Develop new features for the website using Angular front end, Node.js services with a focus on positive end-user experience.
  • Deploying code from GitHub to the cloud on Azure, leveraging different Azure services.
  • Create good quality extensible code, avoid code smell, and refactor existing code base to increase readability and performance.
  • Attend Agile – Scrum calls and brainstorm ideas during all the meetings to bring diversity on the table
  • Work directly with CEO and Product Managers to enhance existing features or to develop new features for Terkel
  • Follow coding discipline and collaborate with the tech team on GitHub to share tasks and to update the existing code.

Ready to help small businesses sustainably grow their companies? Here are the things that stand out on a resume when we evaluate candidates:

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or other relevant fields
  • 3.5 GPA or above
  • Experience in full stack software development, cloud development and deployment, creating and using REST endpoints, and working with SQL
  • Experience with source code management using Git
  • Previous experience with web frameworks such as Angular, Node.js, Express etc.
  • Familiarity with styling using CSS, particularly the use of Bootstrap and Flexbox
  • Familiarity with Linux and knowledge of basic Linux commands
  • Solid understanding of good coding practices and willingness to learn and work with new technologies
  • Experience working with open-source libraries and reading online documentation
  • An eye for good visual design and ability to identify optimum user workflow
  • Consistently recognized for passion, energy, and for commitment to small businesses
  • Ensure timely and high-quality of delivery
  • Well versed with Agile and Scrum environments
  • Basic knowledge for Microsoft office and Google Docs and Slides
  • Quick learner with the ability to follow a well-defined process
  • “You Are Unique” – an alignment with our core values
  • Bonus points for experience with tools like Asana, Postman, FileZilla/WinSCP, Azure, GitHub, and MySQL Workbench

Markitors is a great place to grow your knowledge and expertise in a progressive field that is becoming increasingly more complex. We have received three “Best Place To Work” awards and appear on the first page of search results for the term “digital marketing company.”

This is a paid internship and 100% remote position, meaning 100% of work will be done remotely with 0% of work being done in person.

Our fall program offers a 10 week fully immersed experience. You will be assigned a day to day manager in your industry and our program manager will lead you with networking and professional development events.

  • End Date: November 5, 2021

  • Hours: 20 hours a week (Monday-Friday)

  • Pay Rate: All ALSAC interns are paid. Pay rate is based on work location.

Specific Internship Description and Preferred Skills:

The Enterprise Application Service Team (EAST) provides operational support for other software product teams to allow them to focus on building new capabilities and enhancements. Majors preferred: Computer Science, Information Technology/Systems, Software Engineering/Development, Electrical Engineering, Data Science

Experience working with: Microsoft Database SQL Server (TSQL, SSIS), Excel, Reporting (Tableau, SSRS)

An internship position is available at the Bioinformatic and Analytics Research Collaborative (BARC) - a new bioinformatics core at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. The participant will be trained in advanced image analysis techniques and will apply these skills to support diverse projects of the microscopy imaging community at UNC.

Image bioinformatics is an exciting and fast-developing domain of bioinformatics that uses computational techniques to extract quantitative information from microscopy images. With the ever-increasing complexity and throughput of microscopy experiments, it focuses on providing algorithmic solutions to reproducibly describe and maximize the understanding of biological images.

Under the guidance of a mentor, the successful candidate will be involved in the following activities:

  • Providing analysis of microscopy images to various research groups at UNC.
  • Creating and deploying customized analysis tools.
  • On-site support and training of researchers in using image analysis tools.

Minimum Qualifications:

Demonstrated possession of the competencies necessary to perform the work.

We are looking for a candidate with:

  • Background in computer science or computational biology.
  • Ability to code in a scripting language (e.g. Python, R or Matlab).
  • Strong interest in learning and applying image analysis techniques.
  • Good communication skills and the ability to share ideas with people from both biological and technical backgrounds.
  • Ability to juggle projects and deal with competing demands while keeping track of time and deliverables.
  • The capability of working independently and as a part of a diverse team.


Previous experience with image/data science projects and HPC/Cloud Computing is preferred but not required.

We offer:

  • A thriving interdisciplinary research environment.
  • An opportunity to work on novel image data science approaches.
  • Possibilities to develop new skills in both image and general bioinformatics.

At Zippin, we are on the verge of transforming physical retail by deploying our AI powered checkout free tech in several HUNDRED stores in stadiums, airports and convenience stores. We are well funded (Series B) and our stores have served several THOUSANDS of customers with a close to 100% overall accuracy! All of this is driven by our cutting edge research in deep learning/computer vision!

There's never been a more exciting time in retail. Frictionless experiences are being demanded by shoppers who are tired of waiting in line and want to zip in and out of their favorite stores. Retailers want to understand their customers on a much deeper level in order to anticipate exactly what the shopper needs, and provide the highest level of service.

The Zippin platform-as-a-service provides a checkout-free solution for all kinds of stores, transportation hubs, sports arenas, business and university dining locations, and any other physical retail space. Shoppers are able to walk in the store, pick up what they want, and then leave. We use machine learning, computer vision, and sensor fusion to automatically charge shoppers when they walk out—a paradigm shift in the shopper experience, with no lines.

Zippin was founded in the San Francisco Bay Area, and has a remote-first philosophy with teammates geographically distributed across the United States, Canada, and India.. Zippin was founded by industry veterans from Amazon, SRI, and VMware, and raised over $15M in venture funding from Evolv, NTT Docomo, SAP, and Maven Ventures to support our ambitious growth goals during our Series A. We’re continuing that growth, and accelerating into the future, currently fundraising for our Series B.

Working at Zippin

Our Vision
To become the operating system for the store of the future.

Our Mission
Our mission is to save shoppers time, improve their in-store experience and increase brand loyalty, while making retailers more profitable.

Our Values
Zippin is a values-based organization. We have a culture shaped by a clear set of ground rules establishing a framework and principles for decision-making, behaviors and a sense of community.

  • Innovation - We have an ambitious vision, and any change, especially the zealous kind, requires big ideas.

  • Accountability - Our teammates have intrinsic enjoyment in taking ownership and delivering on what they say they will.
  • Customer Focus - We care the most about what benefits our customers and partners.

The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) is the leading global environmental authority that sets the global environmental agenda, promotes the coherent implementation of the environment sustainable development within the United Nations system and serves as an authoritative advocate for the global environment. UNEP is the United Nations system's designated entity for addressing issues at the global and regional level. The internship position is located in the UNEP/New York Office.

The internship is for a period of six (6) months. It is unpaid and full-time. Interns will work five days (35-40 hours) per week
The Internship is UNPAID and full-time.
Interns work five days per week (35-40 hours) under the supervision of a staff member in the department or office to which they are assigned.

In the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, applicants may be requested to undertake the internship remotely in view of constraints regarding visa issuance, international travel and access to UN premises. Applicants must be willing and prepared to undertake the internship remotely for a part or the entirety of the internship. The work hours during the internship shall be determined based on individual discussion between the intern and the supervisor(s) taking into consideration the minimum requirements of the Organization and the time difference between the hosting office and the location of the intern.

Under the supervision of the Head of Communications, New York Office, the intern will:

  • Assist in producing communication products for events organized by UNEP in New York including and not limited to infographics, flyers, posters, banners, videos and others

  • Ensure that UNEP New York website is updated regularly with new stories and events
  • Assist with outreach and media for events organized by UNEP in New York, including the organization of press briefings and conferences
  • When required, attend and summarize key discussions on meetings at UN Headquarters, including meetings organized by the Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC), Security Council and UN missions in New York.

  • Speaks and writes clearly and effectively
  • Listens to others, correctly interprets messages from others and responds appropriately

Work Experience

No working experience is required to apply for the United Nations Internship Programme. Your training, education, advance course work or skills should benefit the United Nations during your internship.

position: Frame Design Rule Checking - Fall 2021 Intern
description:
About GLOBALFOUNDRIES:

GLOBALFOUNDRIES is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GLOBALFOUNDRIES makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. GLOBALFOUNDRIES is owned by Mubadala Investment Company. For more information, visit www.globalfoundries.com .

Summary of Role :

GLOBALFOUNDRIES Fab 8/9/10 Frame Team, which is part of the Tapeout organization, is seeking a talented and motivated person to join the team who is pursuing semiconductor product, design automation or software development skills.

The Tapeout organization is responsible for the successful delivery of photomasks to our wafer fabs. The delivery of photomasks involves several design and computational processes, one of which is the wafer inline process monitoring content (PCM) included in a physical structure known as the Frame which borders our customers designs. Designing of the Frame involves optical, electrical and physical structures that are translated onto each photomask level in parallel with the customers design and mask manufacturing content.

You will primarily be responsible for learning how Frames spanning several different technology nodes incorporate additional content via automation to meet manufacturability criteria and then interpret as well as translate layout design rules into a Mentor Graphics Calibre svrf scripted Frame Design Rule Checking (DRC) tool. Additionally, you may develop documentation as required associated with the DRC enablement. The technologies nodes may include Bulk, SOI, RF CMOS or other differentiated offerings. You will be a member of the broader Global Tapeout Operations team that produces masks encompassing both the Frame and product chip designs. Other tasks may include writing programs using scripting languages to continuously improve the efficiency of generating Frames in a quality manner. A person in this role will have the opportunity to interact with Frame Engineers, Design Manual Owners, Design Rule Engineers, and Design Enablement as well as Process Design Kit (PDK) Engineers. The person in this role must be able to work effectively in a remote learning and work setting as your immediate Manager and your primary Mentor may reside at a different site than you will be located. This position is planned to be located at the GLOBALFOUNDRIES site in Austin, Texas.

The intern will have the opportunity to learn about a semiconductor Foundry’s Frame verification approach as well as at least one Design Rule Checking (DRC) methodology while gaining exposure to industry offered Electronic Design Automation (EDA) tools.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Learn how Frames spanning several different technology nodes incorporate additional content via automation
  • Interpret and translate layout design rules into a Mentor Graphics Calibre svrf scripted Design Rule Checking (DRC) deck
  • Develop documentation as required associated with the DRC enablement
  • Write programs using scripting languages to continuously improve the efficiency of generating Frames
  • Interact with interact with Frame Engineers, Design Manual Owners, Design Rule Engineers, and Design Enablement as well as Process Design Kit (PDK) Engineers
  • Work effectively in a remote learning and work setting

Other Responsibilities:

  • Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs

Required Qualifications:

  • Enrolled in a BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science degree
  • Experience with Python or Shell Scripting
  • Experience using Cadence Virtuoso or an equivalent design layout tool
  • Experience using a Design Rule Checking (DRC) tool, such as Mentor Graphics Calibre
  • Fluency in English Language – written & verbal
  • Travel: 0-to-10% Travel required

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience coding a Design Rule Checking (DRC) tool, specifically Mentor Graphics Calibre svrf
  • Experience using Cadence Quickview or an equivalent design viewing tool
  • Experience using office productivity software tools (preferably Microsoft products)
  • Prior experience as an intern in the Semiconductor industry in a related role, such as PDK development or Tapeout with knowledge in related areas such as mask data preparation, inline metrology, reticle construction, testchips, reticle frame building, OPC or mask manufacturing
  • Familiar with Software Engineering with Programming Languages (Java, Perl) or scripting language (Korn Shell) on a Linux platform or relational database experience
  • Familiar with programming (React, JSP, Spring Framework, JavaScript/Dojo, LDAP, AJAX, Rest Services, JBoss, CSS and LSF)

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at usaccommodations@globalfoundries.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.

Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. At Dolby, science meets art, and high tech means more than computer code. As a member of the Dolby team, you’ll see and hear the results of your work everywhere, from movie theaters to smartphones.


As an intern, the Dolby U program offers impactful, project-based work experience in a collaborative, creative environment where you work side by side with industry leaders. Amplify your insatiable curiosity by implementing real-world solutions that revolutionize how people communicate and how entertainment is created, delivered, and enjoyed worldwide. For anyone seeking to gain invaluable expertise through meaningful, personal contributions, join us to design a future where technology meets entertainment!


SUMMARY
Dolby’s Applied Vision Science Group is a small collaborative team within Dolby that investigates perceptual aspects of the human visual system and turns what we learn into image processing algorithms for improving perceived video quality. Understanding the relationship between science, art, and engineering is key to doing this well. Our group is looking for a motivated and energetic engineer/scientist to join our team in Sunnyvale, CA, and contribute to this meaningful effort.

One of the questions that intrigue us is “How do we perceive motion?”. Our goal is to expand the reach of deep learning algorithms to address the question. We are specifically looking for a talented, curious, and inventive individual to assist in developing deep learning approaches to frame rate conversion algorithms. You will apply your skills in deep learning architectures to invent novel network architectures for converting between a wide range of frame rates, and applicable to a wide range of content. You will help the team investigate and improve the cost functions and datasets required for training, subjectively and objectively evaluate, and demonstrate the results, and work with engineering teams and product management to deploy the algorithms in a wide variety of processing environments (cloud, servers, GPU, SoC).


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Invent novel CNN architectures for converting to both higher and lower arbitrary frame rates, for a wide range of content types, with the very highest level of visual quality
  • Work with expert engineering teams to deploy deep learning algorithms to a wide range of processing environments while maintaining our high standards for image quality
  • Deliver internal and external technology presentations and feasibility/proof of performance demonstrations
  • Generate new intellectual property, in the form of patents, workflows, ecosystems, and know-how
  • Write software that is efficient, clean, modular, bug-free, understandable to others, and well documented

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Understanding of human perception (how we see and interpret motion)
  • Experience in developing deep neural network training and optimization in leading frameworks (e.g. Pytorch, Tensorflow) (Experience deploying deep neural networks in products desirable)
  • Experience using Matlab/Python for image processing
  • Experience with GPU programming
  • Track record of successful research accomplishments, published papers, and/or patent applications in the field of color science and/or video processing.
  • Excellent communication and critical thinking skills; ability to prototype quickly; a team-oriented work ethic, and ability to work under minimal supervision
  • Familiarity with and/or strong interest in learning about:
    • Media streaming technology
    • Audio and/or video fundamentals and encoding methods
    • Data analytics

ELIGIBILITY

  • Working towards a Master’s degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Imaging Science, Computer Graphics or a related field; recent grads who are within 6 months of graduation are also eligible to apply.
  • Must be available to work full-time Monday – Friday for 3 months between September 2021 – December 2021. The start date for this position is Monday, September 20, 2021. Please note the start date is not flexible.


Dolby will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code, Article 49, and Administrative Code, Article 12


Equal Employment Opportunity:
Dolby is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Our success depends on the combined skills and talents of all our employees. We are committed to making employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, marital status, family status, medical condition, disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances.

The Boring Company was founded to solve the problem of soul-destroying traffic by creating an underground network of tunnels. Today, we are creating the technology to increase tunneling speed and decrease costs by a factor of 10 or more with the ultimate goal of making Hyperloop adoption viable and enabling rapid transit across densely populated regions.

As a Software Engineering Intern you will be responsible for helping build a completely new underground transportation system: the Las Vegas Loop. Every day we perform thousands of rides and collect gigabytes of data: within this role, you will primarily focus on designing and developing tools for collecting, analyzing and displaying insightful data and graphs for the Las Vegas Loop.

Responsibilities

  • Improve Loop operational efficiency by deploying web tools for various teams at TBC
  • Formulate statistical metrics to evaluate the Las Vegas Loop performance
  • Develop and deploy web tools to display such performance metrics
  • Clearly document and communicate design proposals
  • Support the Las Vegas Loop during hours of operations, eventually during weekends or holidays when necessary

Basic Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent field
  • Prior experience in software development projects (industry or school)
  • Proficiency in 2 or more coding languages
  • Experience with Web Technologies: HTML, CSS, JS, Node.js and at least one of jQuery, React, Angular, Vue or similar
  • Understanding of how to develop Web APIs including concepts such as REST
  • Familiar with communication protocols, such as HTTP, TCP, UDP
  • Solid mathematics and statistics fundamentals

Preferred Skills and Experience

  • Ability to quickly adapt to new projects and learn new languages, technologies and concepts under tight time constraints
  • Experience with Python
  • Understanding of networking
  • Experience with Computer Science competitions such as The International Olympiad in Informatics

Additional Requirements

  • Ability to work long hours and weekends as necessary

We're a team of dedicated, smart, and scrappy people. Our employees are passionate about our mission and determined to innovate at every opportunity.
