2021 Internship: IT

OFFICE LOCATION: New York City

Organization Overview

REFORM Alliance is a national organization seeking to safely reduce the number of people on probation and parole and create real pathways to work and wellness for people who have been supervised instead of supported. In 2021 our focus is on state and federal probation and parole policy reform.

REFORM was launched in 2019 by award-winning recording artist Meek Mill; Philadelphia 76ers co-owner and Fanatics executive chairman Michael Rubin; Arnold Ventures co-founder Laura Arnold; entrepreneur and business mogul Shawn “JAY-Z” Carter; Kraft Group CEO and New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft; Galaxy Digital CEO and founder Michael E. Novogratz; Vista Equity Partners founder, chairman, CEO Robert F. Smith, Brooklyn Nets co-owner and philanthropic investor Clara Wu Tsai; and CNN host and activist Van Jones.

We are using all the resources we have to help fix the flawed criminal justice system in the United States by changing laws and policies, and building a movement of REFORMers to help change hearts and minds.

2021 IT Internship Program Overview

REFORM is seeking candidates for our 2021 summer internship program. The ideal candidate for the IT internship is a college or graduate student in IT, computer science or engineering; is passionate about criminal justice reform; and is a self-starter who is eager to learn in a team environment.

We want to ensure that our group of 2021 summer interns includes people who have lived experience with the justice system. People who have been directly impacted by or involved with the justice system are encouraged to apply, to identify in their application that they have lived experience, and to share any details about that experience that they feel comfortable sharing.

The IT internship is an opportunity to grow the intern’s knowledge of their chosen field of IT - as well as the intern’s exposure to the power of storytelling and the fight to reform the justice system. This is a non-exempt position and students receive an hourly rate, exposure to leaders in this space and company initiatives, and the opportunity to build transferable business skills. Projects are designed to build knowledge, skills, and professional experience.

The IT Internship will start as soon as possible and last up to eight weeks. The Intern will work and participate in internship activities from 9:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. Monday through Thursday. Interns will be paid $15/hour for 20 hours/week.

PROJECTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES


The Intern: IT will shadow and support the IT Coordinator in managing facilities and IT operations in our New York and Washington DC offices. The intern will have exposure to leadership and staff at REFORM.

Specific Duties

  • Help the IT Coordinator to maintain daily office operations. Serve as a point person for staff for anything related to office systems, including building-related logistics, IT support & supplies requests.
  • Assist the IT Coordinator with employee onboarding; provision workstations for new employees; ensure new employees are set up on printers and with vendors, have keys or access cards as applicable; order business cards.
  • Deployment of new software on employee workstations via scripts or scheduled tasks in REFORM’s mobile device management system.
  • Provide support related to new software or tasks asked by the Administrative Team.
  • Ensure a positive guest experience.
  • Provide assistance to the IT Coordinator in the administration of online accounts - Emails, Meraki Mobile device management, Vmware Carbon Black, Cisco Umbrella, Zoom, et al. - Assign (and remove) users where applicable, keep account payment method updated, keep active user lists current, help to troubleshoot user issues.
  • Provide assistance to the IT Coordinator in the preparation of meeting room technology in advance to ensure smooth internal and external meetings. Take appropriate steps to ensure teleconferencing and video conferencing run smoothly. Assist staff with sending meeting invitations for sensitive or tech-focused meetings.
  • Provide IT and User Support relating to technical issues involving Microsoft’s core business applications and Operating Systems and Google Workspace and other software, hardware and applications - including onsite and remote user support.
  • Other tasks as assigned.

REFORM’s stakeholders, including its Board members, guests, and employees, are very important to REFORM’s identity and success. The IT Coordinator is responsible for ensuring these stakeholders have a consistent, smooth, and positive experience and impression of REFORM. By shadowing and supporting the IT Coordinator, the Intern: IT will contribute to the REFORM team and overall mission.

QUALIFICATIONS

Ability to work in a team setting as well as independently with minimal supervision. Provide your own laptop.

As part of these roles, you will be expected to work with microcontrollers, FPGAs, and various board-level hardware/software to achieve the desired system functionality.   • Development and optimize firmware/software used for controlling the hardware components of complex electronic-photonic chips with multiple high-speed SerDes
  • Perform chip bring-up and initial functional test of new custom silicon
  • Work closely with both integrated circuit designers and optical designers to understand chip features and operating modes
  • Work closely with test engineers to hand off chip testing platform after initial silicon bringup
  • Work closely with firmware/software engineers on various programming tasks

  • Experience in silicon bring-up and firmware development for high-speed SerDes
  • Experience with high speed digital communications silicon/system products.
  • Experience working with and interfacing with microcontrollers and/or FPGAs through serial communication
  • Experience prototyping or designing PCB-level hardware, including schematic design, component selection, chip interface management (SPI, I2C, etc.), and PCB layout

About Ayar Labs

At Ayar Labs we are about to revolutionize computing by moving data with light. We’re unleashing processing power for artificial intelligence, high performance computing, and telecommunications by removing the bottlenecks created by today’s electrical I/O - making it possible to continue scaling computing system performance. Ayar Labs is the first to deliver in-package optical I/O chiplets, a new universal I/O solution that replaces traditional electrical I/O and enables chips to communicate with each other from millimeters to kilometers, to deliver orders of magnitude improvements in latency, bandwidth density, and power consumption.

With our strong collaborations with industry leaders and government, our deep ties to MIT and UC Berkeley, and our commitment to hiring the best engineers in photonics and electronics, joining our team gives you the opportunity to collaborate with renowned experts on challenging, paradigm-shifting work.

We are passionate about delivering in-package optical I/O at scale, leveraging the strength of our patent portfolio and our team of leading interdisciplinary experts. We believe that deep cross-collaboration between teams facilitated by honest, open debate is the best way to drive innovation and achieve big wins. Join our team and experience the possibilities.
Resources:

position: QA Associate - Expert Summer Intern Programme - 2022
description:
The team that delivers world-class solutions

Our Quantitative Analytics team is a global organization of highly specialized quantitative modelers and developers. QA is an integral part of the bank, responsible for developing, testing, implementing and supporting quantitative models for valuation and risk management of traded assets, regulatory and economic capital, impairments, fraud detection, asset-liability management, operational risk, net revenue and balance sheet forecasting, and stress testing across Barclays.

The chance to make a real impact


As an intern in the Quantitative Analytics team, you’ll gain valuable exposure to real-world problems in our dynamic and invigorating environment. During your internship, you will have the chance to work on cutting-edge quantitative and technology problems, which include:

  • apply quantitative techniques to solve real-world business problems
  • research, develop and implement new models and solutions
  • improve our computing or data infrastructure.

A place where you can thrive

At Barclays, you’ll be surrounded by experts in the industry, who will help you achieve your goals and ambitions. Our collaborative, supportive environment gives you the chance to build solid relationships with senior leaders and peers alike. During the program, you’ll also benefit from in-depth, comprehensive training.

What’s more, this could be the beginning of an exciting and rewarding career. We offer full-time employment opportunities to those interns demonstrating excellent work ethics and technical competence upon the completion of their internship.

To be considered for this program, you must:

  • be a PhD or Master’s student with an anticipated graduation date between December 2022 – June 2023
  • be in a technical discipline such as Quantitative Finance, Statistics, Operations Research, Econometrics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Machine Learning or similar.

Ideally, you would also have:


  • a GPA of 3.2 or above
  • strong analytical, mathematical, statistical and/or programming skills
  • clear communication skills and track record of collaborative team work.

Ready to apply?

Please go to Barclays’ online system, select the “2022 Quantitative Analytics Summer Associate Program” and submit your application.


About Barclays

Barclays is a British universal bank. We are diversified by business, by different types of customers and clients, and by geography. Our businesses include consumer banking and payments operations around the world, as well as a top-tier, full service, global corporate and investment bank, all of which are supported by our service company which provides technology, operations and functional services across the firm.


We are an equal opportunity employer and we are opposed to discrimination on any grounds.

Our Purpose and Values

We deploy finance responsibly to support people and businesses, acting with empathy and integrity, championing innovation and sustainability for the common good and the long term.


Our values underpin everything we do: Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and Stewardship.


Respect

We harness the power of diversity and inclusion in our business, trust those we work with, and value everyone's contribution.

  • Be given immediate responsibility through assignments like position tracking, calculating risk, and analyzing vital theoretical values

What you bring to the team…

  • Are pursuing a bachelor’s, master’s or PhD in mathematics, economics, physics, statistics, computer science or any engineering related field and have an expected graduation date between December 2022 and June 2023
  • Advanced quantitative, analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to deploy those skills under time-sensitive situations
  • Proficient programming in Python
  • Are self-motivated, enjoy challenges and significant responsibility, and thrive in fast-paced, competitive environments
  • A passion for the financial markets and a deep curiosity to explore new methodologies
  • Strong communication skills to advocate your ideas in a clear and concise manner to the group

What to expect during the internship

  • Meaningful projects: Each project, advised by a trader, promotes a comprehensive learning experience and provides you with real-world work experience.
  • Community: Throughout the summer, we host a variety of educational, social and team-building activities to explore the city, foster friendships and camaraderie.
  • Housing: DRW provides fully furnished apartments located close to the office – making your morning commute as easy as possible.
  • Mentorship: You’ll build a professional relationship with an experienced mentor in your field. Mentors and mentees meet to discuss goals, challenges and professional development and explore the city together at our mentor outings.
  • Education: As the trading industry continually evolves, both in terms of new products and transaction methods, the future will present us with unique opportunities and challenges. You’ll complete an options course taught by an experienced trader and participate in a technology immersion course to better understand how technology and trading intersect.

DRW is a technology-driven, diversified principal trading firm. We trade our own capital at our own risk, across a broad range of asset classes, instruments and strategies, in financial markets around the world. As the markets have evolved over the past 25 years, so has DRW – maximizing opportunities to include real estate, cryptoassets and venture capital. With over 1,000 employees at our Chicago headquarters and offices around the world, we work together to solve complex problems, challenge consensus and deliver meaningful results. It’s a place of high expectations, deep curiosity and thoughtful collaboration.
